column4: Hello! I have a problem with dpkg. I tried to install k3d and something was broken in dpkg database. Now I get an error when I try to use apt-get and dpkg ( pasted in : http://pastebin.ca/272309 ) ... Could someone help me to restore or rebuild dpkg database please? Thank you!
looks like a bug in the package.  Please pastebin 'apt-cache policy k3d'.  Have you searched bugs.ubuntu.com?
I want to make dpkg or apt to ignore that k3d package that seems to have a bug, and has a pending action
we can probably just edit the preremoval script and fix the bug, it's a typo
yes, but how can I restore now my dpkg database? Now I can't use apt or dpkg because of that pending action :(
can you pastebin 'apt-cache policy k3d' please?
I'm looking at it now... let's see
my suggestion was going to be to edit /var/lib/dpkg/status and fix the error
but I can't see which is the error
someone wrote Python-versions and it should be Python-version without the 's'
make a backup before editing that file
orion2012 : thanks for your helping today! I solved my problem!
great, how did you end up doing it?
